title: Three-seed Porridge With Ginger And Blueberries
summary: Three-seed Porridge With Ginger And Blueberries might be just the morn meal you are searching for. One serving contains 943 calories, 12g of protein, and 77g of fat. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.51 per serving. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegetarian diet. 122 people have tried and liked this recipe. If you have knob ginger, blueberries, buckwheat groats, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 27 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 74%. This score is solid. Try Quinoa Porridge with Blueberries and Pecans, Blueberries ‘n’ Cream Amaranth Porridge, and Goldilocks Chia Seed Porridge for similar recipes.
instructions: The night before you plan to serve the porridge, coarsely grind buckwheat and quinoa in a hand-crank grain grind or a spice grinder. Transfer the freshly ground buckwheat and quinoa to a mixing bowl and stir in amaranth. Cover with three to four cups hot water and stir in one tablespoon lemon juice. Allow the pseudocereals to soak for at least twelve hours. Drain and rinse.Melt ghee in a medium-sized heavy-bottom saucepan over moderate heat, stir in ginger and fry until fragrant  about three minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in soaked buckwheat, quinoa and amaranth as well as unrefined sea salt and whole milk or heavy cream. Add a cinnamon stick to the pot and simmer, stirring continuously for eight to ten minutes or until the porridge is cooked through and thickened to your liking. Remove cinnamon stick from porridge, fold in blueberries. Sweeten to taste with maple syrup or honey, and serve with additional whole milk or heavy cream as it suits you.

steps.step: The night before you plan to serve the porridge, coarsely grind buckwheat and quinoa in a hand-crank grain grind or a spice grinder.

Transfer the freshly ground buckwheat and quinoa to a mixing bowl and stir in amaranth. Cover with three to four cups hot water and stir in one tablespoon lemon juice. Allow the pseudocereals to soak for at least twelve hours.

Drain and rinse.Melt ghee in a medium-sized heavy-bottom saucepan over moderate heat, stir in ginger and fry until fragrant  about three minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in soaked buckwheat, quinoa and amaranth as well as unrefined sea salt and whole milk or heavy cream.
Add a cinnamon stick to the pot and simmer, stirring continuously for eight to ten minutes or until the porridge is cooked through and thickened to your liking.
Remove cinnamon stick from porridge, fold in blueberries. Sweeten to taste with maple syrup or honey, and serve with additional whole milk or heavy cream as it suits you.
